import { Playground } from 'docz';

import ReactGlobe from './ReactGlobe';

# Camera

The camera controls how we observe and interact with the globe. You can control these behaviors using the `cameraOptions` prop. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultCameraOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

## Zoom

Use the playground code editor to play around with the respective camera options that control zoom features.

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe
    cameraOptions={{
      enableZoom: true,
      distanceRadiusScale: 5,
      maxDistanceRadiusScale: 15,
      zoomSpeed: 2,
    }}
  />
</Playground>

## Auto-rotate and rotate

Use the playground code editor to play around with the respective camera options that control auto-rotate and rotate features.

<Playground>
  <ReactGlobe
    cameraOptions={{
      autoRotateSpeed: 0.5,
      enableAutoRotate: true,
      enableRotate: true,
      maxPolarAngle: (Math.PI * 9) / 16,
      minPolarAngle: (Math.PI * 7) / 16,
      rotateSpeed: 0.1,
    }}
  />
</Playground>
